file_content.text: Hope those Chevin work out alright.
Don't worry. The Chevin will be on their way shortly.
Look at this, Captain. We are approached.
I've got eyes, Nonzo. I can handle this.
You, there--looks like you made it. And with our supplies, too.
We got a message from the Diplomatic Service that someone was coming, but I had my doubts. Glad to see I was wrong.
I have orders from the diplomats--the Chevin are needed elsewhere.
I'm here for the workers.
Are you people safe?
We're surviving, at any rate.
Leave the thinking to your betters.
Fool.
Right. Got it.
We Imperials have to stick together.
I'm glad, too.
When I take a job, I finish it.
You shouldn't doubt me.
No argument there.
Never doubt a Sith, Imperial.
Fool.
I won't--not from now on, anyway.
I'm Captain Guyvar. Nonzo here leads the workers. And all around you is Imperial Works Project 900316A--ecological studies crew.
My boys shoot up the local wildlife--anything with claws, pretty much--while the workers take plant samples and try not to get killed.
It is difficult. Many of us take ill or are hurt by the native creatures. Yet, it is an honor to study the Imperial homeworld.
Nonzo does his job. So what's your story? The transmission we got was garbled... something about needing the Chevin?
Can you spare some to meet a visiting dignitary?
Indeed.
A dignitary, huh? I thought that was a joke--figured you wanted the Chevin for science experiments or something.
It's something like that. You don't need all the details.
Close enough.
Just the Diplomatic Service playing games.
It's political garbage.
Big surprise.
Well, with the supplies you brought, we can probably spare a few. The guards can escort them to Kaas City.
Please, a question--is it true that you need us to meet a representative from the homeworld? I have heard this.
It's true.
Then I ask a favor of you. Let me choose who is sent to Kaas City. Some of my workers are very unwell, and need treatment--
What are you getting at, exactly?
Why do you ask?
I would ask a favor of you.
Let me choose who is sent to Kaas City. Some of my workers are very unwell, and need treatment--
Stay out of this.
All right, Nonzo, get back to work.
Wait, please. I only ask--let me choose who is sent to Kaas City. Some of my workers are very unwell. They need treatment--
Enough, Nonzo. I doubt the Diplomatic Service wants a bunch of weaklings bleeding all over their visitor.
Control your creature, Captain Guyvar.
This interruption annoys me.
I should kill this Chevin for its insolence.
This interruption annoys me.
The man who hired me wouldn't be happy.
The job was very clear.
That's just the nature of the game.
Probably true.
Please. Please listen.
Maybe we can compromise. A few of the injured along with the healthy ones....
Let's discuss this.
The weak would just slow down the escort party.
But the sick workers, the dying workers, they will be very grateful if you send them to the city to be fixed. They will do whatever is needed--
If your workers need help, we should help them.
The Chevin is right.
Listen to our visitor, Captain. Please.
The sick workers, the dying workers, they will be very grateful if you send them to the city to be fixed. They will do whatever is needed--
If they can stand straight long enough.
Look, ignore Nonzo. Pick out whatever Chevin you want, and we'll make sure they get to Kaas City.
The Empire needs only the strongest and heartiest.
The healthy will show better.
That's what I figured. Nonzo, start rounding your people up--I'll look over them myself when you're done.
Yes. Of course, Captain.
Gather up the weak and sick and send them to the city.
Take pity on the injured.
Thank you. You are giving us a great gift.
All right. Your orders, and I'll respect them. Nonzo, start choosing your people.
We'll send the aliens over shortly. I assume you're heading back yourself, so I won't keep you.
Thanks, Captain.
Watch yourself.
Hope to see you back in civilization, someday.
You've done your duty acceptably.
Return to work.
That's the praise I've been waiting to hear. Watch yourself out there, now.
Move along. No interference allowed in Imperial Works Project 900316A.
